metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14492 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in dnsmasq before 2.78 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via a crafted IPv6 router advertisement request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.3
dnsmasq-base - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.3
dnsmasq-utils - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Felix Wilhelm, Fermin J. Serna, Gabriel Campana and Kevin Hamacher

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.3').
